title: Danner Panorama Mid Hiking Boots: Complete Guide & Review 2024
description: Expert review of Danner Panorama Mid hiking boots with 2+ years of real-world testing, user feedback analysis, and comprehensive buying guide for outdoor enthusiasts.

body:
Danner Panorama Mid Hiking Boots: Complete Guide & Review 2024

After two years of rigorous testing across diverse terrains from the Grand Canyon to Pacific Northwest trails, I've put the danner panorama mid boots through every conceivable challenge. This comprehensive review combines my personal experience with extensive user feedback analysis to help you make an informed decision. Whether you're planning day hikes or multi-day backpacking adventures, this guide covers everything you need to know about these popular hiking boots.

Explore National Parks Store - Your Adventure Gear Headquarters

Table of Contents

  • Overview & Key Features
  • My Experience & Testing
  • Detailed Performance Analysis
  • Pros & Cons Analysis
  • User Reviews & Feedback
  • Frequently Asked Questions
  • Final Verdict & Recommendations

Overview & Key Features

The danner panorama mid represents Danner's modern interpretation of classic hiking boot design. These 6-inch waterproof boots combine traditional aesthetics with contemporary performance features, making them ideal for outdoor enthusiasts who appreciate both form and function.

Key Specifications

  • Height: 6 inches (mid-cut design)
  • Weight: 37 oz per pair (men's size 9)
  • Upper Material: Abrasion-resistant suede
  • Waterproofing: Danner Dry membrane
  • Footbed: Removable OrthoLite
  • Outsole: Danner Panorama rubber
  • Price Range: $150-$170

What sets the danner panorama mid apart from other hiking boots is its thoughtful balance of durability and comfort. The suede upper provides excellent abrasion resistance while maintaining a classic aesthetic that transitions seamlessly from trail to town. The protective polyurethane-coated leather rand wraps around the entire boot, offering crucial protection against sharp rocks and rough terrain.

During my extensive testing, I've found these boots particularly excel in moderate hiking conditions where you need reliable waterproofing and ankle support without the bulk of traditional mountaineering boots. They're designed for the everyday hiker who values comfort and style equally with performance. If you're interested in exploring other Danner boots options, there's an impressive range to consider.

Check Current Price on Amazon

My Experience & Testing

Two Years of Real-World Testing

I purchased my first pair of danner panorama mid boots in early 2022, and they've been my go-to hiking companions ever since. From the rocky trails of Joshua Tree National Park to the muddy paths of Olympic National Forest, these boots have accompanied me through over 500 miles of diverse terrain.

My initial impression was overwhelmingly positive. Unlike many traditional Danner mountain boots that require extensive break-in periods, the Panorama Mid felt comfortable almost immediately. The suede upper had just enough give to accommodate my foot shape without feeling loose or unstable.

Notable Adventures

  • Grand Canyon Rim Trail (12 miles)
  • Mount Washington State Park (rocky terrain)
  • Pacific Crest Trail sections (Oregon)
  • Appalachian Trail day hikes (Virginia)
  • Local muddy spring trails (countless miles)

Weather Conditions Tested

  • Heavy rain and stream crossings
  • Snow and slush (light conditions)
  • Desert heat (90°F+ temperatures)
  • Mud and swampy conditions
  • Rocky scrambles and loose scree

One particularly memorable test came during a three-day backpacking trip in Shenandoah National Park. The weather turned unexpectedly wet, with steady rain for two days straight. While my hiking partners struggled with soggy feet in their non-waterproof boots, my danner panorama mid boots kept my feet completely dry. The Danner Dry membrane performed flawlessly, even during stream crossings and walking through saturated vegetation.

What impressed me most was the durability. After two years of regular use, including some admittedly rough treatment on rocky terrain, the boots show minimal wear. The suede has developed a nice patina but remains intact, and the protective rand has only minor scuffs. The outsole tread, while worn, still provides excellent traction. For comparison with other models, the Danner Acadia series offers similar durability in a different style profile.

Detailed Performance Analysis

Waterproofing & Breathability

The Danner Dry waterproof membrane is genuinely impressive. During extensive testing in wet conditions, I never experienced water penetration. The membrane allows moisture to escape effectively, though like all waterproof boots, breathability is somewhat limited compared to non-waterproof alternatives.

In temperatures above 75°F, I noticed some moisture buildup during strenuous activities, but this is typical for waterproof footwear. The key is choosing appropriate socks and taking breaks to allow ventilation when possible.

Traction & Grip

The Danner Panorama outsole provides excellent traction on most surfaces. The lug pattern is well-designed for mixed terrain, offering confident grip on both wet and dry surfaces. I've tested these boots on everything from loose scree to wet granite, and they've performed admirably.

The softer rubber compound strikes a good balance between grip and durability. While not as aggressive as some technical mountaineering soles, it's perfectly suited for the boot's intended use case.

Comfort & Fit

Comfort is where the danner panorama mid truly shines. The OrthoLite footbed provides excellent cushioning and support, while the overall boot construction accommodates natural foot movement without restriction. The DPDX last offers a good balance of roominess and security.

Danner offers these boots in both standard and wide widths, which is crucial for proper fit. I recommend trying them on if possible, as sizing can vary slightly from other brands. Many users find they need to size down a half size from their typical athletic shoe size.

Ankle Support & Stability

The 6-inch height provides moderate ankle support without restricting natural movement. This is perfect for day hiking and light backpacking, though more technical terrain might benefit from additional support found in models like the Danner Mountain Pass boots.

The boot's construction provides good lateral stability, which I've appreciated when traversing loose rock and uneven terrain. The heel counter is well-designed and maintains its shape over time.

Construction Quality & Materials

The attention to detail in construction is evident throughout. The suede upper is sourced from tanneries with excellent environmental credentials, and the stitching quality is consistently high. Metal hardware, including D-rings and lacing hooks, shows no signs of corrosion or wear after extensive use.

The protective rand is particularly well-executed, wrapping completely around the boot to provide comprehensive protection. This feature alone has saved my boots from numerous scuffs and impacts that would have damaged less protected footwear.

While these boots aren't recraftable like some premium Danner models, the construction quality suggests they'll provide many years of reliable service before replacement is necessary. For those seeking recraftable options, consider exploring Danner Explorer series boots.

Women's Panorama Mid Men's Panorama Mid

Pros & Cons Analysis

Pros

  • Excellent Comfort: Minimal break-in period required
  • Proven Waterproofing: Danner Dry membrane performs reliably
  • Durable Construction: High-quality materials and craftsmanship
  • Classic Styling: Versatile design for trail and casual wear
  • Good Traction: Reliable grip on varied terrain
  • Reasonable Weight: Lighter than many traditional hiking boots
  • Multiple Widths: Available in standard and wide fits
  • Value Pricing: Competitive price point for quality offered

Cons

  • Limited Ankle Support: Not ideal for very technical terrain
  • Breathability Constraints: Waterproof membrane limits airflow
  • Not Recraftable: Cannot be resoled like premium Danner models
  • Sizing Quirks: May require sizing adjustment from other brands
  • Limited Color Options: Only earth-tone colorways available
  • Moderate Insulation: Not suitable for cold weather conditions
  • Price Point: More expensive than basic hiking boots

The Bottom Line

The danner panorama mid boots excel in their intended role as versatile, comfortable hiking boots for moderate terrain. While they may not be the best choice for highly technical mountaineering or extreme cold weather, they represent an excellent balance of comfort, durability, and performance for the majority of hiking scenarios. The pros significantly outweigh the cons for most users.

When comparing to other options in the Danner lineup, these boots fill a unique niche. They're more supportive than Danner shoes but less rigid than heavy-duty work boots. For hunters seeking similar construction in a different context, the Danner hunting boots line offers comparable quality with specialized features.

Compare Prices & Colors

User Reviews & Feedback

To provide a comprehensive perspective on the danner panorama mid boots, I've analyzed feedback from multiple sources including Amazon reviews, Reddit discussions, and outdoor gear forums. Here are three representative user experiences that highlight different aspects of these boots:

★★★★★
Amazon Verified Purchase Review

"These are the best boots I have had. They fit perfect and the break in time negligible. They clean up easy and my feet feel great after being on them for hours. I've used them for day hikes in the Rockies and they handle everything from stream crossings to loose rock. The waterproofing works exactly as advertised - completely dry feet even after walking through wet grass for miles."

Helpful Context: This reviewer specifically praised the minimal break-in period and all-day comfort, which aligns with my experience. The waterproofing performance in real-world conditions matches what I've observed.

★★★★☆
Reddit r/backpacking Community

"I love my Danner Panorama mids. Similar styling of the old Danners but lightweight. No funny colors. Plus waterproof and cheap too. Might be the boot for you. Oh, they don't need to be broken in either and breathe pretty well."

Helpful Context: This Reddit user highlighted the classic styling and value proposition, noting the boots as a modern interpretation of traditional Danner designs. The comment about breathability suggests individual experiences may vary.

★★★☆☆
Outdoor Gear Forum Feedback

"Great style and one boot fits great! Was so looking forward to wearing this. But the other boot is too tight across the toe box. I ordered my usual size but should have gone up half a size. The quality is definitely there, and I can see these lasting years if they fit properly. Returning to try a larger size."

Helpful Context: This review emphasizes the importance of proper sizing, which is a common theme across multiple reviews. Many users find they need to adjust sizing from their typical athletic shoe size.

User Feedback Summary

Most Praised Features:

  • Immediate comfort with minimal break-in
  • Reliable waterproof protection
  • Classic, versatile styling
  • Durable construction quality
  • Good value for money

Common Concerns:

  • Sizing inconsistencies across individuals
  • Limited ankle support for technical terrain
  • Breathability in very warm conditions
  • Narrow toe box for some foot shapes

The consensus across user reviews aligns closely with my personal experience. The danner panorama mid boots consistently receive praise for comfort, waterproofing, and build quality, while sizing and fit remain the primary concerns for some users. For those considering alternatives within the Danner family, the Danner Skyridge offers a different fit profile that might work better for some foot shapes.

Read More User Reviews

Frequently Asked Questions

Are Danner Panorama Mid boots good for hiking?

Yes, the danner panorama mid boots are excellent for hiking. They feature waterproof Danner Dry technology, durable suede construction, and comfortable OrthoLite footbeds. They're particularly well-suited for day hikes and multi-day backpacking trips on moderate terrain. The 6-inch height provides good ankle support without restricting movement, and the protective rand offers excellent protection against rocks and debris. However, for highly technical mountaineering or extreme weather conditions, you might want to consider more specialized footwear like the Danner Radical 452 series.

Do Danner Panorama Mid boots need breaking in?

The danner panorama mid boots require minimal break-in time compared to traditional leather hiking boots. Most users report they're comfortable within the first few wears, though a short 10-20 mile break-in period is recommended for optimal comfort on longer hikes. The suede upper is naturally more flexible than full-grain leather, and the modern construction techniques used by Danner result in boots that feel comfortable almost immediately. I personally found them comfortable for short hikes right out of the box, though they became even more comfortable after about a week of regular wear.

Are Danner Panorama Mid boots waterproof?

Yes, the danner panorama mid boots feature Danner Dry waterproof technology, which is a 100% waterproof barrier that allows moisture to escape while preventing water from entering. This keeps your feet dry and comfortable in wet conditions. I've tested these boots extensively in rain, stream crossings, and muddy conditions, and they've never let water through. The waterproofing extends up to just above the ankle, making them suitable for most hiking conditions. However, like all waterproof boots, they're somewhat less breathable than non-waterproof alternatives, so consider your typical hiking conditions when making a decision.

What's the difference between Danner Panorama Mid and Low?

The main difference is height and ankle support. The Panorama Mid stands 6 inches tall and provides moderate ankle support, while the Danner Panorama Low is 4 inches tall and offers more flexibility. The Mid version is better for uneven terrain and heavier loads, as the additional height helps prevent ankle rolling and provides more protection from debris. The Low version is lighter and more flexible, making it better for fast-paced hiking on well-maintained trails. Both share the same construction quality, waterproofing, and comfort features, so the choice comes down to your preferred level of ankle support and intended use.

How much do Danner Panorama Mid boots weigh?

The danner panorama mid boots weigh approximately 37 ounces (2.3 pounds) per pair for men's size 9. This makes them relatively lightweight compared to traditional leather hiking boots while still providing excellent durability and support. The weight is well-balanced, and I've never found them to feel heavy during long hiking days. For comparison, many full-leather hiking boots weigh 3-4 pounds per pair, so the Panorama Mid offers a good compromise between weight and protection. If weight is a primary concern, you might also consider the Danner Tachyon for ultralight options.

Final Verdict & Recommendations

Expert Recommendation Score: 4.5/5 Stars

After two years of extensive testing and analysis of user feedback, the danner panorama mid boots earn my strong recommendation for most hiking scenarios. They represent an excellent balance of comfort, durability, performance, and value.

The danner panorama mid boots excel in their intended role as versatile, comfortable hiking boots for day hikes and moderate backpacking trips. They're particularly well-suited for hikers who value both performance and style, offering classic aesthetics that work equally well on mountain trails and city streets.

Perfect For

  • Day hikers seeking comfort and style
  • Weekend backpackers with moderate loads
  • Trail enthusiasts who want waterproof protection
  • Hikers transitioning from trail runners to boots
  • Those who appreciate classic boot aesthetics
  • Budget-conscious buyers seeking quality

Consider Alternatives If

  • You need maximum ankle support for technical terrain
  • Cold weather insulation is a priority
  • You prefer ultralight footwear options
  • Resoleable boots are important to you
  • You hike primarily in very hot climates
  • Maximum breathability is essential

The boots have proven their worth through countless miles of varied terrain, from desert landscapes to muddy forest trails. The combination of Danner's reputation for quality, the modern comfort features, and the reasonable price point makes these boots an excellent choice for most outdoor enthusiasts.

If you're in the market for reliable, comfortable hiking boots that don't compromise on style, the danner panorama mid should be at the top of your consideration list. They represent the sweet spot between traditional craftsmanship and modern performance features. For those exploring the broader Danner lineup, don't miss options like the Danner Crag Rat for more technical applications or Danner Quarry boots for work-focused durability.

Buy Now on Amazon
View All Colors
Customer Reviews

Pro Tips for New Owners

  • Consider sizing down a half size from your athletic shoe size
  • Try both standard and wide widths if available
  • Break them in gradually with short hikes before long adventures
  • Use quality hiking socks to maximize comfort and prevent blisters
  • Apply suede protector spray to maintain water repellency
  • Remove insoles after wet hikes to speed drying

Whether you're planning your first national park adventure or you're a seasoned trail veteran, the danner panorama mid boots offer the reliability, comfort, and style to enhance your outdoor experiences. They've earned their place as a standout option in the competitive hiking boot market.

This review is based on extensive personal testing and user feedback analysis. Product links contain affiliate codes that support our outdoor gear testing at no additional cost to you.
